a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: The Living Planet Index (LPI) measures the average relative decline in monitored wildlife populations. The index
value measures the change in abundance in 38,427 populations across 5,268 species relative to the year 1970
Data source: World Wildlife Fund (WWF) and Zoological Society of London (2022)
Note: Some regions of the world are will have experienced significant biodiversity loss prior to 1970, this earlier loss will not captured in
